thread.title: Trump: Health care is ‘so complicated,’ but ACA will be replaced - MarketWatch
thread.title_full: Trump: Health care is ‘so complicated,’ but ACA will be replaced - MarketWatch

author: Louise Radnofsky ,     Anna Mathews ,   and   Michelle Hackman
title: Trump: Health care is ‘so complicated,’ but ACA will be replaced - MarketWatch
text:
WASHINGTON — President Donald Trump, heading into a critical stretch of Republicans’ push to rewrite the Affordable Care Act, acknowledged Monday the effort would be complex and politically risky, but said he is determined to forge ahead because the ACA is a “disaster.”
“Nobody knew that health care could be so complicated,” Trump told a group of Republican governors after meeting with them and insurers — two groups whose cooperation could make or break the attempt to overturn the law some call Obamacare.
Read: Kasich says GOP may need Democrats to ensure health coverage for millions
A spirited campaign by Democrats to preserve the law by warning that repealing it would be catastrophic has boosted support for it and led to raucous town-hall meetings held by members of Congress across the country. That has rattled some GOP lawmakers whose votes the party cannot afford to lose. The president alluded to such political perils in his remarks.
“As soon as we touch it — if we do the most minute thing, just a tiny little change — what’s going to happen?” Trump told the governors. “They’re going to say it’s the Republicans’ problem. That’s the way it is, but we have to do what’s right, because Obamacare is a failed disaster.”
An expanded version of this report appears on WSJ.com.
GOP Plan to Repeal Obamacare: Hope It's Not Blocked (4:31) Republican leaders who are preparing a bill to repeal Obamacare have a new strategy: betting that fellow GOP lawmakers will think twice about blocking it. WSJ's Louise Radnofsky explains on Lunch Break with Tanya Rivero. Photo: Reuters
